courses.subject: Intro-Level IS Course
courses.customDesc:
Choose one of the following: ES112, HIST206, HIST216, ISLA123, JOUR219, JOUR228, RELS201, WGQS201, WGQS210.

Required in Major or Support; some courses also satisfy a General Education (GE) requirement or the USCP.

courses.subject: GE
courses.customDesc: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, Lower-Division E, F, and GE Elective (8). Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Area D Elective, Upper-Division D, or E.

courses.subject: Basic Statistics Course
courses.customDesc:
Choose one of the following: STAT130, STAT217, or STAT218.

Required in Major or Support; some courses also satisfy a General Education (GE) requirement or the USCP.

Any GE Upper-Division STAT course may be substituted to fulfill this major requirement. Non-GE courses teaching statistical or quantitative analysis methods may be substituted to satisfy this requirement but only with the consent of the ISLA Department Chair. In those cases, students will then have to take an additional course to satisfy the GE requirement.

courses.subject: Communication Course
courses.customDesc:
Choose one of the following: COMS213, COMS322, COMS385; ENGL311, ENGL312, ENGL317, ENGL467; PSY304.

Required in Major or Support; some courses also satisfy a General Education (GE) requirement or the USCP.

If a course is taken to meet the Communication Course or Upper-Division Electives requirement, it cannot be double-counted in the Concentration. Please consult with academic advisor.

courses.subject: Science Communication Track Course
courses.customDesc:
Any Science Communication Track course can go here.

To ensure an interdisciplinary course of study, courses chosen should be from at least two different disciplines (as indicated by distinct course prefixes) and no more than half of them can have the same course prefix. The student is responsible for checking prerequisites for all courses. See catalog for more concentration details.

Select 4 units from the Science Communication Track: AGC475; COMS317, COMS390, COMS395, COMS418, COMS422; ISLA305.

courses.subject: Science, Technology, and Society Elective
courses.customDesc:
Any Science, Technology, and Society Elective course can go here.

To ensure an interdisciplinary course of study, courses chosen should be from at least two different disciplines (as indicated by distinct course prefixes) and no more than half of them can have the same course prefix. The student is responsible for checking prerequisites for all courses. See catalog for more concentration details.

Select 20 units from the Science, Technology, and Society Electives: Any courses that were not taken to satisfy the core requirements above can count as electives; BRAE348; GEOG325; HIST350, HIST355, HIST407, HIST432; ISLA303, ISLA330, ISLA440, ISLA456; POLS451; PSC307, PSC320; WLC370.

courses.subject: Graduation Writing Requirement
courses.customDesc: Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.
